title: Workmaster 25  I welded a quick attach plow first time out.

tasks.task: Weld and operate a plow blade for clearing snow.
subtasks: Purchase weld-on plates and a plow blade.
Weld the plates and blade to prepare the plow.
Install angle cylinders on the plow for proper positioning.
Attach necessary pins for the plow mechanism.
Connect hydraulic hoses to the plow system.
Test and adjust the plow's operation on the parking lot.
Operate the tractor and plow to clear snow, managing hydraulics and angle.
Ensure proper function of shuttle mechanism for shifting.
Safely maneuver the tractor and plow around obstacles.
Address minor issues such as hose drooping and adjusting the plow's angle.

tasks.task: Preparing and operating a tractor attachment for clearing a parking lot.
subtasks: Assemble the plow attachment by welding components.
Connect hydraulic lines and tensioners.
Connect the plow to the tractor using the quick hitch.
Perform preliminary checks (e.g., oil, battery) before operation.
Clear the parking lot by following drive patterns for effective snow removal.
Adjust snow throw angle and blade height as needed.
Manage hydraulic controls to lift and lower the plow.
Navigate around obstacles and corners while operating the plow.
Handle any issues that arise during operation, such as stuck pins or hydraulic leaks.

tasks.task: Maintenance and problem-solving with farming equipment.
subtasks: Examining and troubleshooting hydraulic system components.
Applying lubricants (e.g., New Holland hydraulic oil) to prevent issues.
Releasing hydraulic pressure to facilitate movement or adjustment.
Reassessing and modifying plow setup based on performance.
Researching alternative solutions for inefficiencies (e.g., floatation) if necessary.
